(a) Calculate the total net benefit of placing three advertisements. Show your work.

(b) Calculate the marginal net benefit of the third advertisement. Show your work.

(c) What is the optimal number of advertisements placed by <math alttext="A Z Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AZY</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Foods? Explain using marginal analysis.

(d) Suppose over the next year the marginal benefit that <math alttext="A Z Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AZY</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Foods receives from each advertisement increases by <math alttext="$300" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>300</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Identify the optimal number of advertisements.

(e) There are many firms in the retail food market. Each firm places its own firm-specific advertisements without considering the actions of its competitors. In what market structure is <math alttext="A Z Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AZY</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Foods operating?
